result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Douglas J Hoppens was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1000 cash bond applied.  Defendant to pay balance at $50 a month.
1st 5 days without release.  He can be released on electronic monitoring after that.  He is to participate and comply with OWI Court program

Do not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from a licensed physician.

No bars or taverns

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2
on behalf of def

3:42 pm Def in court w/Atty Thomas Y. Huh.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands.  No threats/force.  Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  No voting or firearms and deportation advised.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.

Count 2 - Operating With a BAC - 5th  (BAC: .304)  (Fel)  GUILTY       Count 1 - Dismissed

COURT is satisfied that the plea is F, I & V made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
Kellis believes the recommendation is appropriate.  Not much of a criminal record outside of OWI's.  There was an accident w/o injuries.  I don't believe a straight jail sentence is appropriate here.  Not asking for a PSI.  Huh not asking for a PSI.  Feels the State's recommendation is a fair one.  Asks the Court to consider a straight jail sentence.  We have many indications here that does make Doug an exception.  He doesn't have any criminal record other than OWI's.  His last OWI convictions are 14, 16 and 19 years ago.  Because of his past record, he technically is an alcoholic.  He was at his brother's house who suddenly passed away and Doug found him.  He went and told his father.  It was an unusual event and he drank heavily.  He feels horrible about trying to drive home.  He's fully cogniscent and takes full responsibility and knows he's going to get punished here.  No violations on bond.  He was also released from JS testing.  His Ins. has paid off the restitution.  He plans to participate in OWI Court.  Asks for the 1 year CJ instead of probation and a manditory 6 mos.  Hoppens comments.  Court comments.

SENTENCE:
$4,611 + $25 blood draw fee - apply cash bond, the $25 bd fee first, then $50/mo by 9/5/14
AA and DSP
DL rev 36 mos w/ IID for 36 mos
365 days CJ - the first 5 days w/o release starting immediately - he may be released on em after that.
Participate in and comply with OWI Court
No alcohol or controlled substances w/o Rx
No bars or taverns
